page.title: 17 Local History
page.content: This area has{Saxon}origins.{WYRMSLAND farm means "land of the dragon"and a {TUMULUS}exists in a near by field.In Mediavel times the dead were protected by a dragon.Place names ending in-COTT indicate line of battle created by the {Celts and Saxons}along the boundary of the{R.ATTERY.}The house at Wyrmsland may be haunted after a suicide hanging over 100 years ago.The sound of horses hooves,shaking of chairs with people still seated and footsteps upstairs have all been the experience of{Joan {Rendell}local historian whose personal knowledge of the S.E. part of our area is described in her book{"GATEWAY to {CORNWALL."}She has lived between North Petherwin and Yeolmbridge villages all her life.The{COLE'S }have lived at {CULLACOTT}for 3 generations,present home dated{1885 }part of original manor house still exists built{1579.
